links.title: eRuby - Wikipedia
links.description: eRuby (Embedded Ruby) is a templating system that embeds Ruby into a text document. It is often used to embed Ruby code in an HTML document, similar to ASP, JSP and PHP and other server-side scripting languages. The templating system of eRuby combines the ruby code and the plain text to provide flow control and variable substitution, thus making it easy to maintain.[1]

At Stripe, we’ve always been intentional about how we communicate, share information, and stay connected. Back when Stripe was smaller, it was easy for this to happen automatically. links.description: Caller ID authorization is a new system aimed at combating illegal caller ID spoofing. Industry stakeholders are working to implement caller ID authentication, which is sometimes called SHAKEN/STIR.

links.title: Unreal mode - Wikipedia
links.description: In x86 computing, unreal mode, also big real mode, huge real mode, or flat real mode, is a variant of real mode, in which one or more segment descriptors has been loaded with non-standard values, like 32-bit limits allowing to access entire memory. Contrary to its name, it is not a separate addressing mode that the x86 processors can operate in. It is used in the 80286 and later x86 processors.

sure to apply that skepticism evenhandedly, including to yourself, rather than
just using it to argue against anything you disagree with—”
